alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Lewis; Mason; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 3:56PM EST until February 17 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Bracken, Lewis, Mason and Robertson. In Ohio, Adams, Brown, Highland, Pike, Ross and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 355 PM EST, radar indicated heavy rain moving into the area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible into this evening. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chillicothe, Portsmouth, Maysville, Hillsboro, Greenfield, Georgetown, Waverly, Wheelersburg, Washington, Mount Orab, West Union, New Boston, Piketon, Manchester, Peebles, Ripley, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Lynchburg and Leesburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
